{"step_by_step_thinking": "The working length of a tooth is a critical factor in endodontic treatments. The working length is typically determined using radiographic methods or electronic apex locators. In the case of an 8-year-old child, the use of radiographs should be minimized due to the potential harm from radiation. Therefore, an electronic apex locator would be a more suitable method. However, this option is not provided in the choices. Among the given choices, tactile sensation is commonly used in clinical practice to determine the working length, especially when other methods are not available or suitable.", "answer_choice": "A"}
